ygData.subject: Re: Second Weapon
ygData.msgSnippet: No, no ... you have a point there.  Warriors are more of a brutal or barbarian like fighter ... though, not everyone sees them that way.  I thought you were
ygData.messageBody:
No, no ... you have a point there. Warriors are more of a brutal or
barbarian like fighter ... though, not everyone sees them that way. I
thought you were referring to purely non-fictitious warriors, not just known
warriors in general. :)


Jesse Heady
Morgantown, WV
monkey@...
http://www.mountain.net/~monkey
ICQ UIN: 975656


----- Original Message -----
From: Mifsud, Michael <Michael.Mifsud@...>
To: <warriors_eq@onelist.com>
Sent: Monday, May 17, 1999 1:56 AM
Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] Second Weapon


> From: "Mifsud, Michael" <Michael.Mifsud@...>
>
> hmmm I thought of her as well as Xena ;) but I always made a mental
> distinction between a warrior (i.e. a soldier, bred for war, not
interested
> necessarily in honour and chivalry etc. etc. like the Greek and Swiss
> mercenaries) as opposed to Knight type figures (Arthur, Lancelot, Yamato
> etc.). I consider Joan of Arc a Knight more than a warrior. Its just an
> arbitrary mental distinction.
>
> > ----------
> > From: Jesse Heady[SMTP:monkey@...]
> > Reply To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> > Sent: Monday, May 17, 1999 2:51 PM
> > To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> > Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] Second Weapon
> >
> > From: "Jesse Heady" <monkey@...>
> >
> > Aren't you forgetting Joan of Arc?
> >
> > Jesse Heady
> > Morgantown, WV
